definition: one move, two gains (idiom); two birds with one stone
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
variant of 舉|举[ju3]
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: V Don't you think it a double advantage for us?
sentences.chinese: 难道你不认为这对我们来说是一件一举两得的事吗？

sentences.english: Ida: Well, can't it be both?
You just hit two birds with one stone, because making hersmile just made your day.
sentences.chinese: 你只是一举两得，因为逗她笑就是你的快乐。

sentences.english: Lastly, it is a kind of thing which kills two birds with one stone.
sentences.chinese: 最后，它是一种能够杀死一举两得。

sentences.english: The water you use to feed him, and he may be acceptable, so do both.
sentences.chinese: 你用这些水喂他，他有可能会接受，这样就一举两得。

definition: What can you have against it? (idiom)/We should do this./Go for it!
to satisfy rival demands (idiom)/to get the best of both worlds/to have it both ways/to have one's cake and eat it too
lit. one arrow, two golden eagles (idiom)/to kill two birds with one stone
couldn't be better/ideal/wonderful
to kill two birds with one stone (idiom)
to neglect neither one
fabulous/superb/excellent
benefit/advantage/gain/profit/also pr. [hao3 chu4]/CL:個|个[ge4]
bringing great benefits (idiom); very useful/of great service/to help greatly/to serve one well
secondly, ...
firstly, ...
sensible act
a fine thing/a wonderful thing
exceptionally good
already/since/both... (and...)
to take a lot of trouble (idiom); painstaking/at the cost of a lot of effort
